meanings.sent1: After eating too much, his kytes were full and round.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's kytes were empty, so it eagerly ate its food.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his kytes were like balloons ready to float away.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter made her kytes jiggle like jelly.
meanings.sent5: The bear's kytes were so big, it looked like it had swallowed a watermelon.

meanings.sent1: The balloon kytes up as more air is blown into it.
meanings.sent2: His cheeks kytes out when he holds his breath.
meanings.sent3: The frog tried to kytes itself up to look bigger to scare away predators.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds kytes ominously before the rain starts.
meanings.sent5: The balloon kytes to the sky, carried by the wind.
